meanings.definition: To scatter or spread in drops or small particles
meanings.sent1: The paint will splatter on the canvas as you flick the brush.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to splatter the sauce on your clothes while cooking.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally splattered the sauce on the ceiling, creating a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to splatter against the window, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The mud from the puddle splattered all over my shoes, leaving a messy trail behind.

meanings.definition: A mark or spot caused by splattering
meanings.sent1: There was a splatter of paint on the wall from the art project.
meanings.sent2: The splatter on the floor indicated a messy cooking session.
meanings.sent3: The cat left a splatter of paw prints across the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: The splatter of ink on the paper resembled a chaotic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The splatter of mud on the car showed it had been on a rough road trip.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something splattering
meanings.sent1: The splatter of rain on the roof was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent2: The loud splatter of the water hitting the ground echoed in the cave.
meanings.sent3: The splatter of popcorn in the microwave signaled movie night was starting.
meanings.sent4: The splatter of paint hitting the canvas was music to the artist's ears.
meanings.sent5: The splatter of mud hitting the window during the storm was a comforting sound.
